This film is absolutely horrible and it was such a waste of gathering all my excitement up for this film because it was so bad. I was so so so looking for forward to this. HOW DARE YOU!!!!!!!!! Scary Movie 5 is terrible. Don't Watch This.

No plans have been made for a sixth film and lets hope it stays that way

review_title: I have to say this was much better then I expected. Laughed throughout. Started funny but then drug to end. I say B-.
review_detailed_main: "I think there's something going on in this house. Something about this mama." After Charlie Sheen dies his kids are left to themselves in a cabin in the woods. When they are found they are returned to his brother and his new wife. The new parents discover that the kids are not normal and strange things begin to happen around the house. There really isn't too much I can say about this movie. I will say that it was much better then I expected, but I also expected it to be very awful. I thought the first movie in the series was funny. I didn't like the second one (because of the tin arm guy). The third one was OK and I really don't remember the fourth one but I know I saw it. I was even more leery about this one because Anna Faris isn't in it. I will admit that I laughed out loud a few times throughout but like most spoof movies it starts out funny then by the end you are just waiting for it to be over. I did expect much worse though. Overall, better then I expected and it did make me laugh. I give it a B-.

The poisonous humor of the Scary Movie spin-offs has seeped into the Scary Movie franchise and destroyed it from within. Epic Movie and Disaster Movie are the worst of the spin-offs and this one is pushing the limits of being grouped in the same category. I found Scary Movie 1 and 2 hilarious. Scary Movie 3 and 4 were also funny. When I heard about this I had hopes and doubts. Unfortunately it turned out like the bad spin-offs. Date Movie was OK... This one was not. I prefer A Haunted House over this one.

I hoped that the days of the Scary Movies were not over. But after 4 years now it seems more likely that this fifth movie killed the Scary Movie franchise.

Still it's not as bad as Epic Movie and Disaster Movie. I think. It's hard to compare bad movies. And I don't really have the need. I did however, have the need to share my distinction between Scary Movie 1-4 and 5.

Bottom line is: IT'S NOT THE SAME AS THE OTHERS! And it most likely spelled the end of the franchise. Which is sad and disappointing. Even though we will always have the memorable and hilarious quadrilogy before this one. The other movies had some lame sections which were survivable. But this whole movie is a lame section. I'm putting all my hopes in the new "A Haunted House" franchise. May it live long and prosper.

I love the original scary movies with the some of the original cast, when they announced this I thought hey I've seen the rest I'll watch this.. omg I wish I hadn't... the beginning was so long and over played I was bored before it even started... I like ashley tisdale but her acting in this was so off, so not her best.. tbh the acting in all of this was shocking... if your tempted dont be you will never that part of your life back...

So, this movie is terrible. Seriously. Want to see the reputation of a decent parody movie franchise go down the crapper? Look no further. This movie feels like it was written and filmed the month before the release date. Yes, that bad.

Run away from this one.

Run far, far away.

The movie was a huge let down they should have never followed through with this, the jokes are very cringe worthy, not even funny. Deffinetly worst of the series, I miss the original cast when the slap stick comedy was original. Shame.

review_detailed_main: Plain awful. Just awful. Atrocious. In fact worse then atrocious.

review_title: I think time has run out for spoofs
review_detailed_main:
Why is every spoof movie taking so much, and turning it so bad, from the paranormal activity and many other great movies, it should be possible to make a spoof that is actually funny and not just lame jokes and bad parodies.

This film is very much concentrated about the Paranormal Activity concept, that franchise have already made kind of a bad situation for themselves and all the spoofs like this one is even worse.

I honestly cannot stress how terrible this movie was. I have seen the other four scary movies, and I didn't ever find them funny (except the first one), but watching this one was ABSOLUTE torture. The humor was mind-glowingly dumb and made zero sense whatsoever. The entire plot made no sense, and all the jokes this movie spits out were so random. Is this movie even a comedy? I think I have seen suspense-thrillers with more humor than this. All this does is just spoof scenes from different movies, and I never laughed a single time.

This movie was bad on so many levels. Every time a character would crack a joke, I just rolled my eyes. The humor consisted of nothing but fart jokes, poop jokes, toilet jokes, slapstick jokes, and stupid sex jokes that are not even funny on paper. There are sex scenes that are not real sex scenes at all, there are a fight scene that looks like a dumb cardboard cartoon off of Youtube, a man who gets injured like every scene from dumb random activities. All in all, this is one of top ten worst movies I have ever seen. It is not so awful that it's good, it is not awful good, it's just AWFUL!!!

review_title: Please kill off the Scary Movie franchise now.
review_detailed_main:
SCARY MOVIE V

Blimey again we have a franchise that doesn't know when to end. This movie should have never been made.

This movie parodies other horror films that have recently come out. In this film we see spoofs of Evil Dead, Mama, Paranormal Activity, Cabin in the Woods, Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Black Swan and Inception.

I loved Scary Movie. I thought the original movie was brilliant. But after the second one they all mingle into one big mess for me. There are far too many parodies out there these days that they have stopped being funny. I guess it is one of those 'too much of a good thing' situations. I have always enjoyed stupid humour. It started when I was a kid and watched the Naked Gun. From then on I always looked out for them. But now it seems they are pushing it too far that it has lost its comedy value. I remember going to the cinema to watch Vampires Suck the whole movie sucked!

Anyway back to Scary Movie 5.

The movie has a lot of famous faces in, but they are mostly just cameos. They even put the cameo stars on the front cover of the DVD it's as if they knew that no-one would watch this unless it has some decent names attached to it. The main character is played by Ashley Tisdale. I was watching this movie looking at her thinking "I know her from somewhere" But I could not remember where I had seen her. Then the nightmare came back to me "NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO". It is Sharpay from High School Musical. I tried my best to delete that film from my memory. But to be honest, she didn't do a bad job in this. She was funny in places and can imagine she could be a comedy actress if she had a decent film to be in. The cameo stars were Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Lohan, Snoop Dogg, Terry Crews, Bow Wow, Heather Locklear, Jerry O'Connell & Mike Tyson. That is one hell of a cast list but they are not really on screen long enough for you to appreciate them. In some cases if you blink, you will miss them.

This film is not all bad. I was laughing out loud to a few scenes. There were some scenes that were very funny. Just not enough of them. I think the main reason I found them funny is because I have seen the movies they were mimicking.

I was also very surprised to see the film was only on for 1 hour 8 minutes (not including the credits). That is very short for a movie and even though it was not a great film I still would have wanted it to go on a bit longer. It felt like they had run out of things to parody so they ended the movie.

Overall the film was amusing in places, but I did find myself watching it with a straight face through a lot of the gags. Mainly because they have been done a million times over. I really hope they don't make any more now. I believe this was the final nail in the Scary Movie coffin.

I will give this film 5 out of 10.

"I'll pay you to get me out of this movie"

review_title: Not quite as bad as the rating suggested
review_detailed_main:
I wouldn't argue this isn't the weakest of all 5 movies or that it's a good movie, but it's not downright awful if you enjoy the others.

There was enough laughs and decent scenes that I felt it was worth watching even if there's a lot of misses as well.

Ashley Tisdale does a decent job replacing Anna Faris but the film definitely missed having the Brenda + Cindy duo in that Black Swan sub-plot.

I'd say 5/10 for the inconsistent laughs, but they're not entirely absent despite a fair few scenes that fall completely flat.

Which says a lot. The humor is unapologetic just like we would expect from a good parody movie. And some of the actors energy was contagious. Which all those various cameos, being highlights of this otherwise mediocre sequel. And maybe that was the true appeal of this last installment. Which storyline goes in all directions at once. And some jokes can be funny, if you make the effort of not being a self important Dbag. Just to be clear, the first movie was the only good one of the franchise. But amongst all those bad sequels, this one isn't so awful after all...

I loved the opening sequence with sheen and lohan, i'm not a very big fan of those two, i just though it was the only funny part of this monstrosity. I nearly died laughing at their bedroom shenanigans, but now that i think about it i might have really been dead, that would explain the rest of the movie.

Everything and the kitchen sink defininitely describes this overworked franchise perfectly. As the latest installment spoofs Paranormal activity, Mama, Black Swan, inception, Evil Dead, Madea and so many other films. Like the last 3 installments most of the jokes are misses but some of them hit way better than they should. And with that being said I'll say that the latest entry is the best the franchise has been since the second film for better or worse. As the film opens Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen are in a bed ready to get it on as they spoof their various life choices cleverly for the most part. But as they are murdered by a sinister force their three children go missing. Months later they are found in the woods "Mama" style by a couple of stoners (Snoop Dogg) and returned to their Uncle (sexy Simon Rex) and his new wife (a perfectly vacuos Ashley Tisdale). Moving things along a spirit haunts their house, they have a super religious hispanic maid, Tisdale rediscovers her love for the ballet with a jealous new lesbian understudy and they go ins earch for an evil book that they changed the ghost into what she is. It's all fairly nonsensical but some of it is actually funny not enough to merit a recommendation but if your super bored or feel you must you could do a lot worse like Scary Movie 3 or 4. **.5/5

review_title: Review the movie on the screen
not good but better then a lot of spoofs made these days
review_detailed_main:
Having a big laugh with the first Scary Movie (2000) the second entry was already a downfall and it got worse with every release. Enter number 5 into the franchise but this time my twelve year old daughter wanted to see it too because Ashley Tisdale (Jody) was in it who she knew from High School Musical (2006). And I must say that she did have a few scene's laughing out loud, especially with the baby but after 30 minutes she went back to her multimedia. Do I need to say more?

I watched it until the end and stated as 85 minutes it stops around 72 minutes, from there on it's the end credits but they warned the viewer, bloopers on the way. So I waited, and watched the bloopers who some looked like they were set in scene. Overall, I did had a smile here and there but still it's a turkey.

It's always so weird to see big names from back in the days coming into the franchise. There only for a few minutes in it so don't pick it up for that reason. This time the story is based on the horror Mama (2013) and the Paranormal Activity franchise. It do works here and there but some parts are really childish or on the edge of slapstick. For me the best part was the spoof on Evil Dead (2013),the split tongue and the removal of the arm, it's all there, and the lesbian scene of Black Swan (2010).

The producers clearly made it for teens because there's no nudity in it. Two girls do have a shower scene but are dressed in their bikinis. It's not good at all but I have to say better then the Twilight spoofs out there or zombie spoofs.

Gore 0,5/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 3/5 Story 2,5/5 Comedy 1/5

review_title: Mind blowingly awful...which is exactly what I expected
It's terribly bad, but we already know before watching it

review_detailed_main:
Punk rocker Jody (Ashley Tisdale) and her ape researcher husband Dan (Simon Rex) are a happily childless couple. Their lives are turned upside down when Dan's lost nieces and baby nephew are found. Despite her objections, he eagerly takes them into their home. The former wild kids claim that they were being looked after by an entity called Mama. Jody has to abandon punk rock and follows her mother's career into ballet.

It is exactly as one expects from the fourth sequel in the horror spoof franchise Scary Movie. It is much too scattered. It doesn't have Anna Faris. None of it rises to be funny. It would be more compelling to stay strictly with Mama even thought that movie isn't that popular or good. The Black Swan stuff is a waste. It would be well advised to fast forward sections of this movie.

Scary Movie V is a disappointing entry in the popular Scary Movie franchise. Despite a strong cast that includes: Snoop Dogg, Charlie Sheen, Terry Crews, Heather Locklear and more, this film doesn't cut it.

The humor has always been juvenile in this series, but this time out most of the jokes fall flat. Writer David Zucker was part of the team that brought us many humorous parody films such as Airplane and The Naked Gun, so my expectations were higher than they should have been for this.

I don't know if it's a lack of familiarity with the material that they're trying to parody or what, but I didn't find Scary Movie V to be funny or entertaining. Maybe it's the watered down PG-13 rating? I thought the series was pretty funny when the Wayans were involved.

Avoid this one. Even if you liked the previous entries.

Ashley Tisdale does her absolute best but even she can't save this film from mediocrity. In this fifth instalment, slapstick runs rather dry and many, many gags outstay their welcome. Hits like Inception, Black Swan and Mama are spoofed earning some healthy laughs but many dated cultural references and pop culture gags fall flat, this isn't as bad as the first two Scary Movie films but it's certainly one of the weakest, reaching to the bottom of the barrel in desperation.

Scary MoVie sees young parents Dan and Jody raise their adopted nieces who have a twisted spirit overlooking them. Jody begins to experience paranormal activity in their new home, and soon realises an evil dead demon is stalking them, Jody must now venture to the cabin in the woods to find the book of the dead and stop the deadly curse, whilst Dan focuses on his job at the Ape research facility. The problem here is too many big films are being spoofed, from Inception, Black Swan, Mama, Evil Dead, Paranormal Activity, Insidious, The Cabin In The Woods, even Tyler Perry's Madea and Fifty Shades Of Grey. Writers David Zucker and Pat Proft cram it all in, the film is bursting at its seams with a lot of bad jokes and a feeling of desperation. The scenes where Simon Rex falls over whilst trying to set up the cameras drove me mental as it wasn't funny, the fight between Dan and Rosa, and the repetition of the Cabin in the woods joke fizzled out quicker than you can say boring. The dancing Mama and the Ape's talking about Matt Damon really killed hope, there's so much that falls flat, the Fifty Shades Of Grey scene was pointless and the Inception scene really felt forced.

However, the whole Black Swan sequences work superbly, the Evil Dead book scene was hilarious and the opening with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan ripping their personal lives maybe lousy but it works. Erica Ash is superb as Kendra, J.P. Manoux is very funny as Pierre the ballet teacher, and Molly Shannon reels out some big laughs as a broken, alcoholic smoking professional dancer, there are some great jokes here, Ashley Tisdale is great at slapstick and she echoes an Anna Faris in the making, although Faris cannot be beat when it comes to these films. The found footage aspects are decent, especially when exploring their new home, seeing Jody smack the baby into the door frame, setting its head on fire then blasting fire extinguishers reign madness, it's unapologetically poor humour but I chuckled.

Running in at under feature length, Scary Movie 5 feels long and exhausting, it tries to be something big but it really is just a squashed mixed bag labelled as a movie, and Director Malcolm D. Lee does nothing to polish or let alone add craft to this tiresome spoof.

review_title: I liked it better than the third and fourth?
review_detailed_main:
(**) out of (****)- ROTTEN

"A Haunted House", "Movie 43", and now "Scary MoVie" in my opinion are actually not the death of cinema and while they are all awful, they do so in a way that's pretty entertaining in a so-bad- it's-good theory but still guys, don't waste your time if you have it elsewhere to spend it on.

After riding of our beloved Anna Faris.. and pretty much everyone, leaving us with Ashley Tisdale left me worried. But actually, I liked Ashley! She put a fresh spin on the genre and is good at playing crazy. Everyone else? direct-to-DVD level acting. The jokes? Immature, gross, mildly amusing. Actually "Mama" and "Black Swan"'s spoofs steal the show.

Clocking at an 80 (last time I checked) minutes, this runs pretty short and without its credits, so if you're hurling at the inaneness of it, it'll be over in no time.

Maybe I'm being more lenient on films because I feel I've been too picky, or maybe I'm just having a field day, but I truly believe there are far worse films out there. That's not to say these aren't bad, but for what I was expecting, not that bad. And Lindsay Lohan pretty much MAKES the movie, even though she's in it in the blink of an eye. And for what it's worth, it's actually better than the tepid 3 and 4 of the series.

review_title: Wish It Was All Sheen and Lohan.
The worst one of the bunch
review_detailed_main:
Since the very beginning this movie had such bad moments that I thought I was watching some kind of cheap parody, I wouldn't be surprised if people walked out of the theaters watching this. The acting was poor and I sincerely feel that Simon Rex should've said no to the role once he read the script, he's better than this. Most of the "funny parts" of the movie were just so terrible, I don't think I laughed once.

Positive notes? The surprising amount of celebrities that were on the cast, quite honestly they made the movie worth watching till the end since you never knew who was showing up next.

This movie is a 1 star or 2 at best although I'm giving it 3 JUST because of the many celebrity cameos, therefore watch at your own risk.

RIP Mac Miller.

review_title: Not the Funniest Spoof But Pretty Fun
Love or hate this nostalgic junk food cinema
review_detailed_main:
In case you didn't know, Hollywood is becoming less and less original. The number of sequels or remakes even seems to be at new heights this year: "Carrie", "Die Hard V", "Evil Dead", "Fast & Furious 6", "Iron Man 3", "Man Of Steel: Superman 6", "Star Trek 12: Into Darkness", "Very Bad Trip 3" and so on. The strange thing is that people seem to want to see the lukewarm old stuff again and again and massively run into the theatres. Guess why I've switched to European and Asian cinema over the years. But from time to time, you go back to the movie theatres on a nostalgic note to watch some of those sequels. I've enjoyed the Scary Movie instalments when I was younger and when a few friends asked me to watch the new output I spontaneously joined them and gave this film a try.

I must admit that this fifth part of the series had a couple of good laughs for those who know horror movies quite well. I laughed about the absurd sex scenes in the "Paranormal Activities" beginning, the stoned dialogues between Snoop Lion and Mac Miller on their way to "The Cabin in The Woods", the strange rituals executed by housemaid "Madea" Maria, the appearance of the intelligent ape Caesar as in "Rise Of The Planet Of The Apes", the "Inception" influenced dream sequence about "Fifty Shades Of Grey" or the religious teenagers in the cabin in the woods reminding of "Evil Dead" were quite funny. On the other side, other passages were rather dull and had their lengths as the "Black Swan" and "Mama" scenes.

I must admit that I got out of the movie theatres with a big smile on my face and I had really enjoyed this entertaining and short flick while it lasted. It's not the best "Scary Movie" but also far from being the worst part of the series. That being said it was better than I had expected it to be.

What really struck me though is the fact I have some problems to call back in mind all the details of this movie. This is due to three reasons. The story line of the movie is even more stupid than usual and had an almost total absence of sense. The acting is even less impressive and more stereotypical than before. I'm aware of the fact that this kind of movie won't win any Academy Awards but this time the flick was only centred around quick jokes and a few cameo appearances. This movie is another meal of Hollywood junk flick food. It's entertaining but after all quite predictable and superficial of course. It's easy to digest but it's quickly gone as well.

In the end, the film can be resumed like this: it's entertaining and quite funny when you watch it but you will soon forget it as well as there is honestly said nothing memorable or outstanding about it. Fans of the first four instalments should watch this fun ride as well. Those who didn't appreciate the first parts won't like this movie either and probably hate the fact that these instalments have been brought back to life again.

review_title: Probably, one of the worst movies series I have ever seen
review_detailed_main: First of all, when I first watched the official trailer of the movie I didn't really liked it and I didn't had high expectations about it. Eventually, it was as bad as I had imagined and I didn't really enjoyed it. The plot of the movie was kinda interesting and different than the previous movies. However, the storyline wasn't well-written, because it was very silly. The characters weren't very interesting, nor well-developed and they were all so annoying. The filming location of the movie was mainly, inside a haunted house. In my opinion, that movie probably had the worst casting and their acting wasn't really good. It wasn't a scary movie and there weren't any jumpscares, even though there were some creepy scenes. Sadly, it wasn't a very funny movie and most jokes were so stupid. The ending scene was definitely predictable and it was just fine. Overall, "Scary Movie 5" wasn't a nice parody film, kinda boring and I wouldn't recommend it to my friends.

Servus from Austria. Watched the movie at home. German dubbed.

Overall impression: Absolutely terrible, sketches were predictable and lacked originality

Story arc: 1/10 There is not much about the story to say. The plot is not coherent, which is an obvious downside of this series anyway.

Entertainment: 2/10 I watched this movie to have a laugh, which I honestly did have at one or the other moment. But apart from these rare rays of hope the movie left me frustrated.

Characters: 2/10 The acting was as bad as it could get in this movie franchise. Acting comedic scenes felt forced.

Originality: 1/10 Since this is the fifth part of the scary movie series, there are not much new elements to discover.

Visuals: 2/10 The visual effects appeared cheap overall.

Sound design: 4/10 Sound effects were alright in my opinion. They were never off.

review_title: Horrible...but probably not deserving to be in the Bottom 100.
review_detailed_main:
I have not seen any of the previous "Scary Movie" films. The reason why I chose to watch this one, the least financially successful and apparently worst one of them is that it has made it to the infamous Bottom 100 on IMDB....the lowest ranked major movies of all time. I have a weird desire to not only see tons of foreign and art films, but occasionally I love a bad film...particularly if they are unintentionally funny. In the case of "Scary Movie 5", it's a case of being unintentionally NOT funny!

When the movie begins, you know you are in for a horrid film as the opening scene stars Lindsay Lohan and Martin Sheen! What follows is a very episodic film starring many C and D-list actors that parodies (or is supposed to parody) scary teen films and a variety of non-scary movies as well. During the course of the story there are jokes about weiners, drugs, feces, demonic possessions, vomit, farting, toilets and other intellectual subjects. These jokes are presented rapid-fire. Most fall pretty flat or are disgusting...and a few actually are funny...but only a few.

Overall, this is a mostly unfunny movie starring many annoying actors....but, it is NOT so horrible that it deserves to be in the Bottom 100. Bottom 250...sure...but I can probably come up with at least 200 films worse than this mess...not that this is any sort of endorsement for you to watch it. If you do...don't say I didn't warn you!!

This is the worst "Scary Movie" yet, for many reasons. Reason 1 - Brenda isn't back! Brenda was played by Regina Hall in the first four films, and she wasn't in this one! Yeah, Anna Faris isn't in it either, but Brenda was the best character! She was the funniest one! Reason 2 - Two people who died in "Scary Movie 4" were back. They played different people though. They were Charlie Sheen and Simon Rex.

It was funny, but it should have been rated R. There is the bottom of a butt, nonstop sexual stuff, and one clear use of the f word, and the n word, used by the physic. If you are a big fan of the franchise, you should go see it, and if you never heard of the series, you can go, because it is not a continuation.

Recommended for 15+

review_title: Embarrassingly bad, from the cast to the spoofs; the franchise reaches a new low
review_detailed_main:
The fifth installment of the popular horror spoof franchise, 'Scary MoVie' is shameful in its badness. With a spoof consisting of mainly 'Mama' and the 'lost footage' horrors, as well as many non-horror films (such as 'Black Swan' or 'Rise of the Planet of Apes'), it is outclassed in every way by 'A Haunted House'.

The 'Scary Movie' franchise, while very fun, tends to lose a bit of strength in each next movie. This time around it is the absence of Anna Faris and Regina Hall, the only regulars since the first one, that brings it down a lot.

Instead, the new cast is atrocious. Ashley Tisdale, of the 'High School Musical' (in)fame, is completely lacking in both the funny, acting or charisma departments; Erica Ash is even more atrocious, and tries too hard to be a substitute for Regina Hall but falls flat; Simon Rex, a returner from the third and fourth films, is likable but ends up far too silly to work. Lidia Porto is another particularly full of bad moments, while the kids are surprisingly better than the adult cast.

And what is there to say about Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan? Their cartoonishly goofy scene at the beginning almost had me giving up on watching.

The jokes fall flat most of the times. Some of the ideas had potential, but were too badly handled to work. In particular, the 'Evil Dead' and 'Black Swan' spoofs and the scenes involving Snoop Dog (Lion?) could have been great; but the first two ended up too stupid to work, whereas the last one was just too dry/badly acted.

The closest to a saving grace this movie has is the 'Inception' spoof, which might be the only moment I laughed at all, and the fact this is a relatively short film at only 86 minutes long. This was just embarrassingly bad.

I found "Scary MoVie" to be a refreshing revisit to the series, especially after parts 3 and 4. However, if you are just the slightest familiar with the "Scary Movie" movies, then you know what you are in for here in this fifth installment - more goofs, spoofs and cheap laughs.

The storyline is basically the same as the previous movies, a vague red line throughout the course of the movie, on which a series of spoof elements of other movies are built up. Does it work? Sure, as there is coherency in the storyline.

"Scary MoVie" does manage to pull off the spoofs in the great way that the the movie series is known for and doing well, compared to other spoof movies available on the market.

However, the movie never really manages to rise itself above mediocrity, rolling on jokes and situations that you see coming a mile away. Is the movie funny? Yeah, to a certain extend. Does it entertain? Yeah, to a certain extend. Is it a movie that is a must to watch? Hardly so.

The people cast for the various roles were doing great jobs with their given silly roles, as always and as in the previous movies. So they are keeping the style going from the previous movies. Also the effects in the movie were quite good and did really work out quite well in favor of the movie. And the movies spoofed in "Scary MoVie" were nicely made fun in great ways and isn't a good spoof always good for a couple of laughs?

review_title: So many big names... Still terrible
review_detailed_main:
Just goes to show you how much the scary movie franchise plummeted after the Wayans stopped making them. So many good actors and celebs in it as well, it had potential to rebuild the franchise, but due to a lack of humour it failed.

I preferred "a haunted house", wasn't the best out of all the wayans films, but in my opinion no one could ever do better than a wayans film. People can steal ideas from the wayans, but no one comes close with the delivery of satire except the greats.

But we're talking about the future of comedy here Leave the comedy to the comics the rapping to the rappers and the acting to the actors. How original was it to use charlie and joke about him dying and partying on. Its not even offensive.... Thats the problem here

review_title: A New Chapter in the 'Scary Movie' Franchise!!!
This movie wasn't even that bad...
review_detailed_main:
Personally I think this movie was actually quite funny. Yes they had a few childish jokes in there but so what?!

It's a comedy not a bloody horror!!!

This movie made me laugh a lot as a matter of fact, But don't watch it if you want an intelligent movie. Watch it with your friends at a party.

However; On the other hand. If you have not seen the movies it is parodying then you are less likely to find it as funny or really understand the jokes to their full extent.

So if you are going to watch this be sure that you have or be sure to watch: Evil Dead Paranormal Activity 1-4 Mama and Insidious.

I won't write any spoilers because there are no spoilers to this movie. There really isn't any point, and I know that generally all the scary movies are supposed to be stupid (and making fun of scary movies) but at least the other ones contained SOME laughs and the jokes/spoofs were funny. I read the reviews previously posted and I thought to myself "hey, maybe people are just looking into it too much and maybe it isn't THAT bad" but only about 5 minutes in did I already realize just how terrible it was. The acting was horrible, the script was horrible ... Ah, I just wasted an hour of my life on that. I was very disappointed and expected a lot more. I seriously don't recommend anyone watch this because you will be severely disappointed.

review_title: Oh dear me please make it stop please. ;(
You will laugh at least twice..and that's a fact.
review_detailed_main:
I thought all the references all came together quite nicely. However, it is not all that funny. I don't recall even laughing at all during the Lindsey Lohan and Charlie Sheen scenes. It just had nothing to offer. And it went nowhere. There were scenes, however that were funny. i enjoyed Snoop Dogg's short performance. He was actually quite funny. I also thought the Nanny in the Paranormal Activity reference was hilarious.

There were plenty of scenes I found funny, but some of them were just so stupid and just so bland that it wasn't funny. I hated the Black Swans references. They just weren't funny at all. It had nothing intelligent to say. It's like a 5 year old just told them what to do.

But there are funny scenes in it, just needed so much more. 4/10

review_title: Wasn't Expecting Much, Worse then I Expected
review_detailed_main: I've been a big scary movie fan and the last two have really let me down. I knew not to expect much based on Scary Movie 4 but was hoping with the amount of hype and good trailer I could expect more. However, this feel very far from the mark, it wasn't humorous at all, I understand they go over the top, but this just looked like they were trying way to hard to be funny, with material that has been done a thousand times. I've seen better low budget parody movies in the last 6 months, that probably had about an 8th of the budget as this. The actors used were of very low talent, and you know you've done something wrong when you cannot even get the series lead star to come back for the fifth movie. Giving this an honest 1/10 because it was really that bad, extremely poor writing, extremely bad acting and just no scene where I could laugh and I laugh at everything.

I didn't make it far I'd put it at 15 minutes at most but that's being generous. What I saw was one stale reference joke after another rapid fire, pacing was terrible, everything was too fast and it just made it feel like one since the jokes don't even land, it feels like these guys were a one trick pony, a reference isn't a joke. Two, it was rushed.

That's all I have to say, it was painful to watch.

review_title: Not even worth to have a fake laugh
review_detailed_main:
Scary movie series were famous for spoofing other great movies. It all began with a decent first, then sequel after sequel declined its originality as well the fun parts. This fifth movie was below average, had some of the good guys in guest roles and that did not bring the movie upwards. I don't know what's with the Snoop Dogg and Mike Tyson's cameo, anyway the movie was almost crap.

During the watch I almost sat idle throughout the movie without having a laugh. I believe that was not intended to give the viewers by this filmmaker, but that is what really happened to me. I know they won't stop here with this, so I say better luck with the next movie of this series.

It's movies like these that make me wonder why normal people can't just put together a story and make a movie. Because honestly, this was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The "Scary Movie" franchise should've stopped after the first one. I didn't mind the second or third films but this one was by far the worst.

A lot of big names are in the movie, mainly Ashley Tisdale who is the main character and I can't believe she read this script and thought "Wow, this is a great idea" but hey, she probably made good money. This spoof mixes "Mama", "Paranormal Activity", "Rise of the Planet of the Apes", "Black Swan" and every single horror film with a cabin in the woods, which is quite a bit. And there is one scene where it makes fun of that exact thing which was probably the funniest scene in the film. And that scene was in the first 5 minute.

The jokes are horrible and way too over the top. I really don't remember much else because I was too bored to care.
This Series Started Funny And Gradually Ending Up Stupid And Boring. The Best Film Out Of The Series Is Scary Movie 4.
This was a lot better then Haunted House. That does not say a lot.

This is what you get when you get greedy, the original movies by the Waynan bros. SM1 & SM2 were fun, funny and original. SM3 was stolen from the bros and done poorly, here we are at SM5 and it's painfully obvious that it lacks the brilliance of the first two. Scary Movie 5 is a knock- off of a knock-off and even as a parody movie it's just awful. I love silly bad movies, but this is just bad bad, nothing to redeem it at all, for the exception of a few cameos. The laughs are few and far between. They would have done better casting unknown actors instead of filling it with D list actors like Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan. Save your money and your time - check out the first two or go see A haunted house instead.

I personally think that it went down the Seltzer/Friedberg Route. Too much Cameos and random Pop culture References, not even the Actors could carry the Film. This and Movie 43 were the biggest "Comedy" disappointments of 2013 so far. Even the rushed Reshoots of Evil Dead and others show they went the Garbage Movie route, parodying something based on Trailers. I went in with low expectations, but with a slight hope that it would be along the lines of funny, Considering this is coming from David Zucker(of Airplane! and Top Secret! fame and of course the unforgettable ZAZ team). What disappointed me the most was that these movies show that spoof is a dying genre, back in the days we had amazing spoofs, now we have garbage. I wasted 10 Euros for this s**t (about 8 dollars) so if anyone is reading this please don't waste your hard earned money on this, go watch The World's End instead, it's not a spoof per se but it is very funny.

David Zucker was the man responsible for some of the funniest spoofs of the 1980s - I'm thinking AIRPLANE! and the NAKED GUN trilogy - so it's sad to see how far his gravitas has fallen in working on the fifth instalment of a film series that was rubbish from the outset. The only good thing about SCARY MOVIE 5 is that Anna Faris isn't in it, which has to be a positive. Other than that, it's business as usual, with no story, tons of cameo appearances, and loads of lame, gross-out jokes.

This film's opening scene, featuring Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, is actually the funniest of the entire movie. It's a short spoof of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, and it plays out ridiculously over the top, as you'd expect, but it did make me laugh out loud. Unfortunately the film then shifts to a pair of uninteresting characters and virtually retells the plot of the horror flick MAMA while throwing in lots of other random spoofs along the way.

This series has always had a scattershot approach so we get riffs on the likes of DAWN OF THE PLANET OF THE APES, EVIL DEAD, and even BLACK SWAN for random measure. The humour is always stupid and only a small handful of the jokes actually work. I guess with Marlon Wayans being out of the franchise the film-makers had to bring in a black 'street' presence, so we get Snoop Dogg in some random, extraneous sub-plot. Terry Crews, Jerry O'Connell, Mike Tyson, and Heather Locklear have cameos. Overall, I'd recommend changing the channel.

2013 has had a very serious lack of comedy. What we have been sold in the comedy genre has been embarrassingly bad, low-brow humor or indie dramatic comedies where the film's emotional core always over-shadows any potential laughs. They are cute but rarely deliver true laugh-out-loud moments. As we patiently wait in anticipation for the master of comedy, Adam McKay, to have his newest film, Anchorman 2, released in theaters, we find ourselves desperate for a fix of comedy. This is how we end up watching a film like Scary Movie V.

The original Scary Movie was a much needed parody of Scream and all the pathetic slasher film rip-offs that followed. While there were some scenes where the film was trying too hard to be funny, the screenplay flawlessly blended together all the slasher flicks that followed Scream and had it's own original twist ending that took bits from all the best films of the 90's. It was the first good parody film since the 80's when Jim Abrahams and Jerry and David Zucker were working together on such classics as The Naked Gun and Airplane!

The poster for Scary Movie had the tagline: No mercy. No shame. No sequel. Yet they didn't just make a shameful sequel, they made 3 of them. Even bringing in David Zucker to take over for Keenen Ivory Wayans as director for parts 3 and 4 didn't help. With every entry in the series, the films only got worse. Even as guilty pleasures to watch with friends for mindless entertainment, they stopped working as all the attempts at jokes were only pop-culture references that quickly became out-dated. We didn't think it could get worse than Scary Movie 4 but we were wrong, dead wrong.

Scary Movie V or Scary MoVie takes both film parodies and film itself to an unprecedented new low. While it's safe to say this will be the worse movie of 2013, it is an understatement. It is worse than that. It's one of the worse films to have ever been made and makes Grown-Ups 2 seem Oscar-worthy.

What a total waste of effort time and money was this piece of crap. I stopped this so called movie after 15 minutes in. I save the stop button for the real stinkers and this one deserves an award in the shape of one. Worst movie ever even cosmopolis lingered longer than 30 minutes on my screen.

Not once did we laugh at the terrible stale jokes convoluted by the most wasted talents ever.

Really have i ever watched a pile of stinking poo like this.

Even The naked gun is watchable compared to it. All people involved should shame their asses of.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WATCH OBLIVION INSTEAD WHICH WAS FANTASTIC!!

I'm gonna go wash my TV now to cleanse of the stink
This isn't a movie. I'm not sure what it is. The writers must have smoked an entire rock of crack thinking this movie was gonna be even remotely appealing.

review_title: Excellent, they just needed a few more laughs,
review_detailed_main:
The whole "Scary Movie" franchise was in my honest opinion dead until the arrival of number 5 which turned the tables around bringing a new set of characters and one or two returning faces. I don't think people are being very enthusiastic about number 5 as it lacks our favourite characters Brenda and Cindy although they are gone we can be sure that there is still some hope that we will meet them once more in the final instalment of "Scary Movie"

While on the subject of the final instalment of the franchise "Scary Movie 6" is rumored to be the whole revival of our classic movies bringing parodies from: The Devil Inside, Insidious, Childs Play, Dark Skies and its hard to forget The Woman In Black.

Well we can only hope to see Brenda and Cindy returning to fight evil once again.

I rarely come onto IMDb to rant about a bad film, i only take the time to write a review if i really enjoyed a certain movie. This however, was dreadful from start to finish. Scary movie 1 and 2 were very funny imo and 3 had a few laughs in it 4 was just about watchable, but this was bad. Its hard to believe how this film was even made and whats more shocking is that the actors actually thought it would be a good idea to be in it.

I will point out that i am not a huge fan of horror films so i may not have a great knowledge on some of the movies being parodied. I shouldn't and wouldn't expect a movie like this to be 10/10 as it is just a silly parody movie and i have seen the others in the series. The writing was okay in the previous ones and there were definitely laughs throughout but this one the writing is awful and the movie relies heavily on slapstick humour. I half giggled once i think in the whole movie.

I wouldn't bother wasting your time to see this, i even think 'A haunted house' is better than this and that is saying something. I can see why Anna Farris wasn't in it.

1/10 I hope this is the last one.

review_title: A parody film for the generation who can't sit still
review_detailed_main:
If there was ever a franchise to run out of steam before it even began and was already too long and overdone simply by having one film in its series, it's a franchise belonging to the modern parody genre. I've mentioned before that this is probably the worst genre in cinematic history, and few other genres have experienced such a rapid decline in quality since their birth. The parody genre is still relatively new in terms of feature-length films, with works such as Airplane! and The Kentucky Fried Movie only dating back to the late seventies.

Why did those films work so well and why does Scary Movie V fail so miserably? Because their prime goal wasn't to parody as many films as possible, but rather try and make fun of genre-conventions and certain obligatory things audiences have become accustomed to for so long. When watching a film like Airplane!, it almost makes you a more aware moviegoer because you're seeing how often these clichés are used and how laughable they actually are when put to a sillier context.

Scary Movie V has nothing - simply nothing - to work with, and for sixty-eight minutes does it lumber lifelessly to the next ridiculous and boring film parody before abandoning it almost entirely. There's so much going on, while simultaneously so little, that the film gets its story lost. It keeps changing tones, parody elements, themes, characters, and events to the point that this is nothing more than an overlong collage of cheaply redone scenes from other films of recent years.

The four main films the picture is predicated off of are Mama, Paranormal Activity, Black Swan, and Rise of the Planet of the Apes. Right off the bat, boy are we a dated party-guest trying desperately to be in-the-loop. Bloody Disgusting's website tells me Scary Movie V began shooting in September 2012, but the film managed to incorporate parodies of Mama and Evil Dead, which didn't hit theaters until the first and second quarters of 2013. This is obviously a move to try and remain current by the time the film comes out. However, because these movies weren't out at the time, the material used to parody them is thin and taken from the trailers, which isn't very convincing or fun. And even so, in three years, who will laugh at these references? More films along the lines of the aforementioned horror films will inevitably be released. Films like Airplane! never get old because their genre-clichés won't allow to them.

For the first time in the franchise's history, Anna Faris and Regina Hall do not appear at all, and the dubious honor of being lead characters in a redundant parody film are handed to Ashley Tisdale and Erica Ash. Other stars such as Lindsay Lohan, Charlie Sheen, Snoop Dogg, Mike Tyson, Jerry O'Connell, and Katt Williams star as predominately cameos in a film where itself is one big cameo in the field of cinema. Nobody looks to be trying here, and frankly, they don't need to. Pat Proft and David Zucker's screenplay leaves almost no imagination and in just over an hour's worth of time manages to make every joke go on for way too long and make one of the tedious comedy ventures so far this year.

While I haven't formally reviewed the previous films in the series, I have seen them all in either the theater or on DVD. The first was a nifty little feature, following in the footsteps of Scream to a reasonably charming effect. The second film is one of the few cases where the sequel is actually more impressive and funnier than the original film (the same thing happened with Scream 2, in my opinion). The third and forth were instantly forgettable endeavors capitalizing off of the goal to make these films more of a competition of references than actual films with plot that feature jabs at conventions and modern films. The series fell off when Shawn and Marlon Wayans were booted, resulting in David Zucker taking over from there. This is when the films became safe, woefully unremarkable, stale, and disposable.

The word for Scary Movie V is "lifeless," as everything from writing, acting, and even directing by Malcolm D. Lee seems to be nothing more than a pitiful cash-in on material gone dry. When a film dedicated to lampooning other films is trying this hard to make the audiences laugh, it doesn't seem to be any better, more sophisticated, or on any other level than the films being mocked.

Starring: Ashley Tisdale, Erica Ash, Simon Rex, Molly Shannon, Heather Locklear, J.P. Manoux, Jerry O'Connell, Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Lohan, Mike Tyson, Snoop Dogg, and Katt Williams. Directed by: Malcolm D. Lee.

review_title: "Scary Movie 5" is certainly the worst of the series so far and t's time for the franchise to rest, being buried six feet under the ground
review_detailed_main:
This is the bitter end to a series that brought the parody genre to the fore again in the early 2000s and, unfortunately, what we see is a depressing ending, and that is not a word that should be used to define a proposed film. Making you laugh. Gathering a handful of actors without criteria was definitely a bad idea and a lack of commitment to the loyal audience of the series, who valued the old cast. The embarrassment of seeing jokes being made without any effect, or the rescue of commonplaces already overused in the previous four features, is to discourage anyone who has followed the development of the first films. The frustration, among other reasons, is to see a comedy that once was so authorial become silly, with bad seats, jokes out of timing and an excess of nonsense that often does not fit the scene.

After David Zucker passed the baton of direction to Malcolm D. Lee, the Scary Movie franchise reached its fifth volume, rivaling in formula and content with the production of Marlon Wayans, Paranormal Inactivity, even coinciding with the parody objects, using the typical first person footage of Paranormal Activity to start your tape. The first news that shocked fans and made us wrinkle our noses was the news that Cindy (Anna Faris) and Brenda (Regina Hall) would not return. How would they manage to make a film in the series without the two main stars? Perhaps the new part of the franchise could be saved by other characters, such as Mahalik (Anthony Anderson), CJ (Kevin Hart) or the president (Leslie Nielsen), but they also don't appear. In fact, "Scary Movie5" does not bring back any character in the franchise, absolutely none. Charlie Sheen and Simon Rex even return, but playing different characters, the first participates in the bad opening scene and the second is one of the protagonists.

After a mysterious incident involving a couple, played by Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan, their daughters Kathy (Gracie Whitton) and Lily (Alva Kolker) somehow - equally mysterious, but this time, because of the script - they end up in a cabin in the forest, where they are found by a pair of stereotyped drug addicts experienced by Snoop Dog and Mac Miller. After being rescued, the children are adopted by their father's brother, Dan (Simon Rex), and his wife Jody (Ashley Tisdale). After that, strange things start to happen at the family home.

Let's talk more about opening this part. The scene begins with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan as a couple about to have sex and who are haunted by a ghost. The scene is ridiculous and sloppy from start to finish, with poor performances and an even worse script, full of exaggerations and appeals to make the viewer laugh forcibly, which does not work. Soon after, we have another "opening scene", in which two friends, played by rappers Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller, come across a hut in the middle of the forest and there are two children. The scene is as ridiculous as the first, with stupid dialogues and even worse performances.

This fifth part of the series focuses on the story of "Mama", but obviously makes reference to several other films - regardless of the genre - during the narrative, such as "Paranormal Activity", "Evil Dead", "The Conjuring", "The Last Exorcism", "Black Swan", "Inception" and the prelude to "Planet of the Apes". Originally, the feature would be a parody of "Panic 4", just as Inceptional was a parody of the first feature in the horror franchise. However, Wes Craven's film did not achieve the expected commercial success, forcing the parody producers to change their minds. This highlights the fragility of the proposal, which depends directly on the public's prior knowledge of other works to be minimally understood.

References to horror films continue, showing Jody's dramas, with repetitive jokes that compare ballet to pole dance. The freak show involving ghosts and demons continues to haunt the existence of the couple, without any condition to make their viewer laugh, making the level of the first four films worse. The tape tries to mix all the aforementioned films looking for an identity, failing to find a minimally acceptable narrative line, since all the elements that add to Jody's drama are completely dispersed from any cohesion or dramaturgical structure. Few of the moments of humor manage to overcome the simple barrier of comedy, not even amusing the public accustomed to torn humorous.

Zucker's departure from directing, for him to only write and produce the film, exhibited a considerable decrease in quality, not even having what worked in the rest of Everyone in Panic. The complete absence of positive predicates makes fans more eager for this cinematographic subgenre to ask themselves if the format has any chance of returning to function as entertainment, because even the undemanding viewer this Scary Movie5 is unable to please.

Incidentally, the main gags of the film are totally unnecessary for the story's progress, demonstrating the lack of creativity and resourcefulness of the writers. This incompetence can also be seen in the appealing content of some scenes, where the extreme bad taste gets to be offensive, especially in the scene involving Lily and an ice lollipop. Some moments try to emulate the silly humor style of silent films, even using stop-motion in a desperate attempt to offer something that the public has not yet seen in previous films. This is so out of context that they look like bonus scenes during the film itself. When a parody reaches the point of parodying itself - as in certain scenes that refer to the first feature of the franchise -, it is a sign that it has reached rock bottom.

The seven intervening years, which took place between the launch of Scary Movie 4 and the production of Scary Movie 5, served to age the type of humor that had been done so far very badly. The audience is different and has aged together. The poorly thought-out sexual scenes are not so pleasing to an audience that in the early 2000s was excited about the bizarre American Pie, and that Scary Movie explored so well. The jokes with the monkeys, the horrible prologue that makes the parody of Paranormal Activity, the first entire act contained of absurdity etc. Takes this film to the bottom of the well. Places that could be used so well here are thrown in the trash.

The prologue's metalanguage, of playing with the figures of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen, does not bring anything new, in fact, it embarrasses the lack of humor in the initial scene, which does not even try to overcome what had already been done. A big problem in this film is the fact that many jokes need to be explained, reaffirmed, many times, by the character who does it. By the way, if humor needs to be explained it is a sign that there is no genuine connection between what is said and the recipient. Already aware of the lack of creativity in the script, many insights are explained within the narrative itself, as in the scene of the newspaper anchor's wife, who needs to reaffirm that she is betraying him - this after the joke has already been made - so that we realize that the scene has a touch of humor. Kind of like making a joke and explaining right away: "Hi, I made a joke, you know?". In fact, narration is used within the film, a resource not previously used, which only highlights the need for this film to seek grace at all costs, even if it explains its own jocularities.

With the departure of Anna Faris and Regina Hall, the cast became very weak. Simon Rex has never been one of the strengths of the franchise, but here it is ridiculously bad. The famous non-actors invited to participate, such as Mac Miller, Snoop Dogg and Usher only make things worse and there is more for Ashley Tisdale, the only one with a really good performance in the film. The actress is no Anna Faris, but she manages to perform quite well in the midst of so much mediocrity. Probably "Scary Movie5" will not have a continuation, not only because of the bad reception by the public, but also because it got the worst box office. If that happens, we will miss Cindy, Brenda, Mahalik, CJ and the others.

As if that were not enough, added to all of this we have a montage out of rhythm and continuity that further impairs the effectiveness of humor, which no longer works by itself. "Scary Movie5" is certainly the worst of the series so far and one of the worst films ever made in recent years. The sensation of total loss of time invades the thought of those who watch the tape until the end, making the prospect worse by imagining that there may be other numbers like this. The relief almost comes after 74 minutes when the final credits go up after it wasn't possible to have a laugh. Malcolm D. Lee's film suffers from the worst thing that can happen to a comedy film: lack of comic timing. It's time for the franchise to rest, being buried six feet under the ground.

review_title: Incoherently related skits bemuse and amuse to extremes

review_detailed_main: Why does this movie exist? It was this question that was spinning in my head throughout the entire viewing of the film-I apologize for calling IT a movie, nevertheless. To begin with, I like the "Scary Movie" franchise. I really think that the first four parts are a very inventive banter on the American cinema of its time. But, I got the impression that this time the screenwriters decided to make banter on the "Scary Movie" by removing humor and meaning from there. What's worth watching this movie for (not worth it)

Scary Movie was a franchise about mocking A list movies, making fun of them and still have some class about that. Scary Movie 5 fails so hard in this attempt, it's not funny, it's stupid, it fails as a comedy. I am not even gonna waste my time writing how wrong everithing is in this movie, DO NOT WATCH!

You know, the Scary Movie franchise might have been stopped being funny after 2, but at the very least 3 & 4 weren't offensively unfunny and had a decent cast (I'm looking at you Seltzerberg.), sadly the same cannot be said for Scary Movie 5. If you've seen any of the trailers, you've pretty much seen the entire movie.

The "plot" follows Ashley Tisdale and Simon Rex mimicking scenes from the latest horror flicks the likes of Paranormal Activity, Sinister, Mama, & Evil Dead, & inserting fart jokes. The movie also features a plethora of celebrity cameos from Jerry O'Connell, Terry Crews, Katt Williams, Snoop Dogg, etc. In a painful attempt to squeeze out a laugh from the audience.

This probably won't surprise any of you but.....All of Scary Movie 5' s attempts at humor are Needlessly Vulgar, And painfully unfunny and actually mean-spirited. The only time I remember laughing was Molly Shannon' s cameo. The biggest problem with this movie (Aside from the fact that it exists.) Is a problem that Selter/Friedberg movies have...they're out of date by the time they hit the theater.

Final Verdict: Skip it!
Some funny Gags if you know what i mean. Nit enough snoop dog as character.

review_title: Possibly the most under-rated movie ever. Certainly the best of the gross-out parodies.
review_detailed_main:
I thought this was just excellent.

I will be the first to say that these parody movies are on the whole pretty terrible. It's not that they're dumb and gross that makes them bad; it's just the laziness in a lot of them.

But here we get another winner. If you enjoyed part 3 and part 4 you're in for another treat. We get a more or less completely new cast of characters but I think it's about time to let Cindy and the gang just chill.

It's so cool to see adult Ashley Tisdale as the woman-child suddenly under parental responsibilities. It's actually more engaging that her counterpart in "Mama".

They pack in a lot of contemporary movie references, fascinatingly woven together, fun gags, some naughty stuff, cute little girls and a few pretty pertinent comments on the aesthetic choices of movies.

Why are people tearing into it? It's basically got all the things that made part 3 and 4 brilliant. How is this one different except in the ways it needs to be to be a different good movie? I'm baffled. Beats part 2 at the very least.

Just put on your sweat pants, put some extra butter on your popcorn and pig out on this low-brow delight.

Scary Movie V (Sometimes called Scary Movie, with the V stylized as the roman numeral for five) is the final installment of the Scary Movie series of horror movie parodies, and was released a good seven years after the fourth film. You'd think with that long a wait, the creators would at least try to improve on the humor so it wouldn't rely too much on gross out toilet and sex humor, but sadly, we are mistaken.

Starting with Charlie Sheen and Lindsay Lohan trying to do a video (can't say which kind in case IMDb guidelines are against it) in a messed up parody of Paranormal Activity, the story begins with Sheen's children being found by two guys who were fleeing from cannibis growers (played by Snoop Dogg and Mac Miller), they are taken under the care of his brother, Dan Sanders, and his wife, Dina. However, by bringing them to a new home, they also bring home a terrible evil.

Basically, the gross humor is back, and it's joined by another kind of humor: child abuse, as some scenes have the children being harmed in what looks like comedic situations (one scene has Aiden, the baby, get his head set on fire, with Dan using a fire extinguisher to put it out, which also launches Kathy, another of the three kids, into something that bumps her head). Also, this film has a lot of disturbing stuff for a film carrying the PG-13 rating, making me wonder how they got away with it. Stay away from this film at all costs.

Either I was still high on the antibiotics I was taking for that viral infection I suffered from or either I've grown entirely numb for awful horror spoofs over the years, but fact remains that I was a lot less irritated by this fifth installment in the "Scary Movie" franchise than by any of the previous ones. Could it be that this latest and still equally redundant sequel is slightly better than the previous ones? Don't get me wrong, it's still a very lackluster effort – hence my four out of ten rating – and it's maximally on par with the mediocre original of the series, but at least I chuckled a couple of times and I even caught myself thinking that a handful of the gags and situations were moderately ingenious! Maybe it's because the annoying lead actress Ana Faris got replaced by the less annoying Brittany Murphy lookalike Ashley Tisdale or perhaps the parody veterans David Zucker and Pat Proft ("Airplane", "Hot Shots!") found their occasional old shape back? Who knows, maybe it's even linked to the fact there was a decent period gap of seven years since the last film this time, whereas the previous films followed each other with an interval of one or two years. Part five primarily focuses itself on spoofing the okay but vastly overrated "Mama". Next to that, it also makes fun of a series of other recent attempts at horror/thriller, including "The Evil Dead" (remake), "Black Swan", "Paranormal Activity" and the latest sequels to "Planet of the Apes". For me personally, it probably helped that I disliked every single one of these flicks. Simon Rex' stupid facial expressions are sometimes fun and particularly the parody of "The Cabin in the Woods" and "The Evil Dead" made me smile. Still 90% of the script is downright embarrassing and even too retarded for words, most notably all sequences with the Latina housemaid and the intelligent monkey. My advice would be not to spend any money on this, but watch it when it comes on television and don't be afraid to fall asleep, since you won't miss out on anything.

review_title: An absolute waste of money, time and popcorn.
review_detailed_main:
Against my own will, I was brought to watch Scary Movie by my friends, expecting to watch a movie that was so awful, I would find good jest amongst it. However, this was not entirely the case. Scary Movie 5 showed a lack of intelligence, that was seen in the first two, and meant for a great lack of enjoyment for the whole film with unfunny and unoriginal jokes that have been poorly used many times before. At times the movie is actually quite repulsing and disturbing with a humor that only the hardest of snuff fans would understand.

The humor in other parts of the film were at times worthy of a chuckle or a smile, but not the whole hearted roaring laughter that the first scary movie scavenged from me. I would not recommend this title to anyone who likes to spend their money on enjoyable movies and popcorn that isn't tossed towards the screen in a violent flurry.

However, one aspect worth merit from me was the portrayal of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen in the opening scenes as they were captured perfectly and did very well playing *themselves.*

You know why I say that, is because she wasn't in Scary Movie 5. She was smart. " I can't agree more.. And there are lot mainstream celebrities in the movie,too many I'm glad I didn't waste money.Mind blowing-ly bad.I know you should expect stuff like this from a scary movie,but this is kinda bad

review_detailed_main:
The Scary Movie franchise has been around a bit and slowly slipped down hill in quality.

But that doesn't mean this isn't one of most fun movies currently out, it has some genuine laugh out loud moments that aren't sexual or crude; sure not many but a few at least.

Taking parts from Inception, The Cabin in the woods, The Curse, The Evil Dead and blending them together is pretty hard but Scary MoVie does pull it off and whilst it's probably not going to win many awards it does exactly what it promises, a silly rather fun parody movie that continues some gross out humour.

review_title: horriawful (worse than horrible and worse than awful)
review_detailed_main:

I had to try it out, although my friends told me not to, because I'm a fan of the scary movie saga. The first one was great, the second was kind of good, the third was hilarious and the fourth was good.

There are so many things that don't make sense in this movie. I didn't crack a smile the WHOLE 86 minutes. I'm being dead serious. It's not even funny because I wasted precious time of my life, but that's what happens when they make very bad movie attempts.

I still have a few questions on my thoughts though... What happened to the movie parodies they used to do? Did they run out of ideas? Why is it so unoriginal, boring and stupid? What's with all the celebrities that don't fit in? Is this a celebrity hangout or something? Who would want to watch that? Is it time to end the scary movie saga here?

If anybody is kind enough to answer my questions I would really appreciate it..

Before I end this I just want to say it is not worth the time nor the money so don't even try! You have been warned!

I feel sorry for everyone who lost one and a half hour of their lives watching this crap. Cheers.

...if you saw someone fall over in the street, not really hurting themselves, would you laugh? Probably. However, if you saw someone fall over in the street twenty to thirty times, would you still find it that amusing? Unfortunately, the latest in the Scary Movie franchise does to rely on people simply falling over again and again (and again) to get the majority of its laughs. And this is a shame, because - believe it or not - there are actually some quite amusing moments in the film.

The first Scary Movie (if you can remember that far back!) parodied Scream and, as a result, followed the story pretty closely. Therefore, Scary Movie (1) actually HAD a story. By the time we arrive at number five, it's a mish-mash of a dozen different horror films, therefore there's hardly a story to speak of. Yes, most of it tries to copy 'Mama' (and if you haven't seen Mama then most of the remaining gags will probably be lost on you), but expect moments from Evil Dead, Paranormal Activity, Inception, Black Swan and Rise of Planet of the Apes.

However, it's not all bad. Ashley Tisdale is surprisingly enjoyable and dippy to watch (a reasonable substitute for the missing Anna Farris) and the opening with Charlie Sheen and Lindsey Lohan mercilessly lampooning themselves is sheer comedy gold (just a pity they're only in the first ten minutes).

If you're a fan of the series, you may get some enjoyment out of it. I think it's certainly better than parts 2 and 4 (which I hated). However, you really have to know ALL the horror movies lampooned to get maximum enjoyment out of it (plus be able to overlook the numerous pratfalls which make up too much of the film).

review_title: Not as bad as the Wayans brothers' two installments.
review_detailed_main:
'SCARY MOVIE 5': Two Stars (Out of Five)

The fifth installment in the never ending 'SCARY MOVIE' franchise, which began in 2000 with the Wayans brothers at the helm (the eldest, Keenen, directed the original film and his brothers Shawn and Marlon co-wrote and co-starred in it). It was a huge financial hit but was also loathed by most critics and movie fans. The second film was helmed by the same trio of Wayans, performing the same duties, but was much less successful at the box office and even more despised by critics and cinephiles. David Zucker (who co-directed and co-wrote such classic spoof comedy films as 'AIRPLANE!', 'THE NAKED GUN: FROM THE FILES OF POLICE SQUAD!', 'TOP SECRET!' and 'BASEKETBALL') took over directing duties (from Keenen Ivory Wayans) on the third film and Craig Mazin (who also co-wrote the 'HANGOVER' sequels) and Pat Proft (who co-wrote such classic comedies as 'POLICE ACADEMY', 'HOT SHOTS!', 'BACHELOR PARTY' and 'REAL GENIUS') took over writing duties. It was a huge hit and a noticeable improvement over the previous installments. Jim Abrahams (who also co-wrote 'AIRPLANE!', 'TOP SECRET!' and 'HOT SHOTS', as well as another classic 'THE KENTUCKY FRIED MOVIE') also joined the writing team on 'SCARY MOVIE 4'. It wasn't quite as good or successful as '3' but it was still a better film than the first two movies. Now we get 'SCARY MOVIE 5', which was written by Zucker and Proft but directed by Malcolm D. Lee (who's directed such hit comedy films as 'UNDERCOVER BROTHER', 'SOUL MEN' and 'THE BEST MAN'). It's not as bad as the Wayans brothers' two installments but it is a lot worse than the last two movies.

Like all the other films in the series it spoofs mostly current hit horror films but it also parodies popular movies in general, as well as pop culture (like the 'Fifty Shades of Grey' novel). This one mainly spoofs the films 'MAMA', 'PARANORMAL ACTIVITY', 'BLACK SWAN', 'RISE OF THE PLANET OF THE APES', 'INCEPTION' and 'EVIL DEAD' (even though the last film was released just a week prior to this movie). The film revolves around Charlie Sheen and his three children going missing. Sheen's kids are then found in the woods, living like wild animals and having been raised by a spirit called 'Mama'. Sheen's brother and brother's girlfriend take the kids in. The movie stars Simon Rex as Sheen's brother (who also appeared in 'SCARY MOVIE 3' and '4', as another character) and Ashley Tisdale as his girlfriend. It features cameos from other stars like Lindsay Lohan, Darrel Hammond, Molly Shannon, Snoop Dog, Heather Locklear and Jerry O'Connell. It's the first film in the series to not feature Anna Faris or Regina Hall.

The film is bad, there's hardly a funny joke in the entire movie, but I still found it amusing. Mostly just because I like movies so much (and especially the horror genre) that I just enjoyed all the film references. I agree with all the critics that it's poorly written and just plain stupid but it at least isn't full of over-the-top gross-out humor like the first two movies and it isn't quite as stupid either (in my opinion). The Wayans' films were painfully bad and unfunny (for me). I couldn't stand watching them. This installment was at least amusing (for me) and I liked watching all the stars in it. It's not as good as 'SCARY MOVIE 3' or '4' but some film nuts might get a slight kick out of it (like I did).

the room with ridiculous clichés .The scary factor is mediocre as this production really shows that it does not understand the trilogy of the balancing of scare factor and humor frequencies in the franchise .Scary Movie 2 had a similar parody box ;The Haunting 1999 and The Exorcist.Even if The Haunting 1999 had very large scare criticisms according to critiques ,Scary Movie 2 still could carry the parody atmosphere with characters like The Caretaker .However ,Scary Movie 5 had a very large parody box thrown on the table for them ;Paranormal Activity ,TheCabinintheWoods and Sinister .These movies boomed above average with their setup and horror avalanche ,but this movie could not seem to understand that .Halfway through ,the ridiculous attempts to make the audience laugh non-stop was just utter rubbish for a horror parody movie.The past 4 movies executed humor with great timing along with its scary factor .The only movie this movie parodied well in their parody box is MAMA .That I am actually impressed .The connection with the other parodied movies collapsed but the sequence and humor was above average ,but still it did not carry the theme of family like in MAMA.The movie tried so hard trying to show the so-called 'family connection' between Jodi as the stepmom and Kathy and Lily and Aidan as the children .The movie didn't even try to show the sense of family relationship and love as we do not see Jodi or Dan even feeding them or showing any signs of family love after Maria was fired .Even with Maria there ,the movie did not give these three a chance to show affectionate love towards the children .All they did was to make Jodi asking herself whether she was getting in touch with them(the children) and expose her to ridiculous humor .Overall,the movie was very close to performing a mediocre showcase.

Malcolm D. Lee's film directs this spoof that spoofs films like the Rise of the Planet of the Apes, Black Swan, Mama, and so on. It's basically about this girl who believes her house is haunted by this terrifying poltergeist.

Is it even safe to talk about the acting? The acting is pretty lame. Ashley Tisdale has the makings of a good actress, but not here. Simon Rex, what on earth happened from the good ol' days of Scary Movie 3? Everyone here made Lindsay Lohan seem like an Oscar-nominated actress.

Overall, Scary Movie 5 is very disappointing because it's just a lame duck. All the Scary Movies are stupid and dumb, but in a fun way. In this film, I did lots of grimacing. There were some good moments here, namely the real-life spoofs of Lindsay Lohan and Charlie Sheen. Here's hoping they make no more of these films. I rate this film 4/10.

The first Scary Movie was decent. It didn't deserve a sequel let alone 4! Scary Movie 3 was alright, mainly because they had replaced the foul juvenile Wayans brothers with the writer of Airplane! and The Naked Gun. Getting rid of the scatological crude humor and bringing in the cleverer intelligent laughs worked. But Scary MoVie is just as bad possibly even worse than the sickening antics of Scary Movie 2.

Usually in a review I would do a summary of the plot. But the writers of Scary MoVie haven't got time for plots! Ashley Tisdale and Simon Rex adopt some weird kids, movie into a new house and vulgar toilet jokes ensue. The weird kids are obviously meant to be like the weird kids from Mama. (SPOOF NUMBER ONE). And Simon Rex works at an ape training lab, which is meant to be like Rise of the Planet of the Apes. (SPOOF NUMBER TWO). His girlfriend Ashley Tisdale is a ballet dancer who is trying to keep the lead role of The Dying Swan which is meant to be like Black Swan. (SPOOF NUMBER THREE).When their asleep loads of jump scares and loud noises are happening, all while being filmed with surveillance cameras. That's meant to be like the Paranormal Activity franchise. (SPOOF NUMBER FOUR). At the beginning of the movie Snoop Dog and some other guy (who looks like Macklemore but isn't Macklemore) are going through a forest and find an old cabin in the woods, that's meant to be like you guessed it The Cabin In The Woods. (SPOOF NUMBER FIVE). Later on Ashley Tisdale goes to the cabin in the woods and a bunch of teenagers are there. There all praising religion and singing cheerful songs, which is the exact opposite of what they do in The Evil Dead. (SPOOF NUMBER SIX). A Morgan Freeman soundalike is narrating the movie, which is meant to be like all those movies which Morgan Freeman has narrated. (SPOOF NUMBER SEVEN). When Ashley Tisdale starts having messed up dreams she gets a dream specialist to help her out. The dream specialist looks exactly like Leonardo Di Caprio from Inception, they even have the bit where he's explaining everything at a cafe. (SPOOF NUMBER EIGHT). And finally for one reason or another Ashley Tisdale ends up in a bedroom about to bang with Christian Grey. That's meant to be like the book 50 Shades of Grey. (SPOOF NUMBER NINE).

So there are 9 different spoofs in an 86 minute movie. That's something like 1 spoof every 8 minutes. When a movie copies a scene or a concept from another movie but adds in some sh*t jokes, it doesn't make a parody it makes a sh*tty mess!

To makes matters worse all of the characters in the movie are annoying and deserve to die. I was trying to think of someone who was likable and appeared in Scary MoVie. But they don't exist! Simon Rex's character wasn't too bad at the start, but he got so stupid it was unbearable. This is just another 21st century spoof movie - not funny at all! There hasn't been an above average spoof movie since 1994 when the third Naked Gun movie came out. It seems to be no longer possible!

Overall I give Scary MoVie 4/10 for 7 laughs throughout the whole 86 minute movie, mainly because of the mildly amusing narrator.
