review_title: Not Much That Hasn't Already Been Said
review_detailed_main:
The Scary Movie franchise grew popularity within the starting of the early 2000's decade as a new and fresh comedy/horror spoof films. Since then there have been many mishaps with the franchise, but each film since its original has seem to appear lower than its processor (with some exceptions) due to subjectivity. However Scary Movie 5 appears to be the lowest the film has sunk. We are witnessed to an unfunny and tiresome spoof film where the directors use tiresome and rehashed jokes to fill time. The film does have certain moments but even in those moments the jokes rarely connect. In general the jokes are mainly misses and the film becomes uninteresting towards the final act. Perhaps it is for the best that this was the final nail in the coffin for the Scary Movie franchise.

=== As a rewatch 01/04/19' Scary Movie 5 remains the worst of the franchise. Having watching the previous films upon the week, and having forgotten much about this film, one remained slightly unaware of how this film was.

This film is quite short in runtime, ending at about 73 minutes (excluding end credits) with many more misses in laughs than hits. The main parodies included Paranormal Activity, Black Swan and Planet of the Apes, along with the Cabin in the Woods, Inception and a few other major blockbusters (many non horror films).

The Inception scene parody was possibly the highlight, along with some of the Ape scenes. There were several cameo appearances but most of them were quite dull. Apart from that, this film was mainly unfunny and reason as to why this was the lowest grossing film of the Scary Movie franchise.

As a rewatch 04/06/23' opinions remain same. Easily the worst film of the franchise and what ultimately killed the franchise. Tries a little too hard in being funny where everything misses.

review_title: It's not worth your time so don't even bother
review_detailed_main:
It's the early 2000s parody formula but "butchered" in 2013. All you need is to base the story on few recent and successful high budget movies, make fun of everything and everyone in the most ridiculous ways, have action/horror which mostly leads to comedy which in this case leads to very bad comedy, sexy girls and everything else you would expect from a parody.

It took them 7 years to finally release another Scary movie. My expectations were low but I didn't realize it would be this bad. It has maybe a few funny moments but the rest of it for me was just painful to watch. I managed to watch it all despite that. I tried to watch it as open-minded I as I possibly could but overall the movie feels like it trying too hard and usually doesn't achieve the goal it pursues. I liked the original few movies of the franchise. They are not good but not too terrible. They are kinda alright and even watchable after all these years but this wasn't and feels like the Scary movie magic is gone.

Overall I think a lot of people will not enjoy it and a small portion will. Personally, after watching the original movie this feels like the worst parody I have ever seen so it's a 2 out of 10 and only because I liked one scene otherwise it would be a 1/10 I wouldn't recommend this to anyone familiar or not with parodies at all.

I mean it. I've been a HUGE fan of all Scary movie's (except the second one, which was awful but watchable), so I got very excited when I knew there was a 5th movie to watch, now that it's on Netflix I decided to continue watching the series but... oh god. I just couldn't stand more than 40 minutes, no laughing at all, the more that I got was some "heh.." twice, that's it. The movie got me SERIOUSLY depressed and I'm not being sarcastic, I was expecting to see another great movie and all I got was cheap repetitive and predictable jokes over and over, with non sense dialog leading no where. This HAS to be the worst movie Simon Rex has been, and that's sad.. because he can do way way better.

2/10, I'll go back to scary movie 3-4 over and over to try and delete this one from my mind.

I can't even begin to describe how much I despise this movie. They seriously cram in as many pop culture references as possible. Some don't even have to do with scary movies! Scary Movie 5 is an unclever, unoriginal parody of films like The Paranormal Activity series and Black Swan (Black Swan, really guys? Are you that desperate for stretching your movie length?). The ONLY thing that I sort of liked in this movie was the stop-motion they used to parody Paranormal Activity, but still every single joke they crammed in there that actually worked they constantly repeated, ruining the joke altogether. It truly is scary what parody movies have become nowadays.
The movie had some fine fun ideas behind it's jokes but the delivery is kind of bad. Also the camera, scenes and acting feels really cheap.

Is this the worst of the Scary Movie films? Not really, Scary Movie 2 still holds that claim, but this movie just might be the killing blow to the franchise. The main parody here is the film "Mama" which I have never seen, probably never will, and as a result, a vast majority of the movies "jokes" flew over my head. The jokes I did understand weren't even that funny. The Inception spoof was probably the funniest part of the movie, but even that only provided a couple of chuckles. I laughed a few times, which is more then Scary Movie 2 (Zero) but the negative reception this film got, as well as poor box office will probably put this franchise to sleep for good.

Then that means you just don't get the humor. It's funny, and is about a B+ movie. But you have to actually watch it and not be messing with your cell phone at the same time. All the negative reviews must be from people "watching" the movie while they are distracted.

The series of "scary movie" are the very fun and hilarious parodies of many nostalgic horror movies, on a very high level of ridiculing every possible things that you might imagine, the very well made structure of the series which is also so simple, is not offensive in any ways to original versions. The first and the second episodes of the series are unbelievably creative and magnificent which I believe makes everybody laugh, but when we move on the third and forth one we see drastic changes in the form of the series, which is expected due to the change of the director. But unbelievably On the fifth part, the series truns on its previous great shape; the fifth part has the lowest rate but i personally believe due to its hallucinating form of jokes is the best one.

Its a Scary Movie !!!! Did you expect an Oscar winner or something?? I thought it was pretty good.....for that type of movie. You just have to have a sense of humor going into it. All the Scary Movies are the same. There's not much more you can do with them. If you didn't like the first one, you will not like any of them. Are they stupid? Yes!!! But they are meant to be!!! If you are looking for award winners, you shouldn't be watching this kind of movie anyway. These are meant for people with a sense of humor......and even a weird sense of humor sometimes. So all the one star submitters probably shouldn't have even tried watching this type of movie to start with. Bad acting....bad special effects. ...weird....politically incorrect scenes. ...is all part of it. So yes....I enjoyed it. It had all the things you would usually expect with a "Scary Movie"

review_title: I love this entry of the quintrilogy!!

review_detailed_main:
I read many of the 'hate' reviews, some from the 'prolific or prominent or prophylactic' reviewers. Let's understand something immediately. If anybody begins a review with "Scary Movie #5 had not ONE funny moment in it", that reviewer is lazy at best and at worst, a liar. Then, other reviewers spend better than 2/3rds of its review discussing the plot and why it may be flawed. Then they score it a one.

This movie is very funny. This movie is often clever. Tisdale and Rex execute clever stuff beautifully. No doubt in my mind they will live up to good scripts and make bad scripts watchable,,--- No doubt.

Do not press the play button with an edgy mood that fosters political correctness and inappropriate expectations, (whatever inappropriate expectations may be) or innovative genius. Expect a funny movie and damn the high brows, and me too if you like.

After the ABYSMAL 3 & 4, this was a welcome retro funny films. Zucker is still a great and funny writer and this had some genuine laugh out loud moments, without the brutally annoying stoned character.

Well done!!!
The single handed greatest thing i've ever seen. This ain't a movie. Its an experience.
